thinking about ow2 just makes me sad. they did us so dirty from the 3 of basically radio silence, followed by a lot of the og team leaving, and then when we get our hands on the game it was so souless. the game has been getting improvement after improvement but at this point the damage has already been done. I will still play this game every now and then, ow is still special to me, but jesus this sequel was handled so poorly, i have no fucking idea what they were doing during their apparent 3-4 years of "development" on this. 5v5 gameplay ranges from kinda fun to oh god please just kill me already. The free to play service aspect is just so badly executed like seriously who is spending 20 dollars for a legendary?? It's actually criminal.

[h1]A shadow of its former glory.[/h1]

Trust me when I say that I had probably around 1000 hours on Overwatch. I got a digital copy of the Origins edition a few weeks after it launched and played it daily for hours on end. And it was great.

It was a very well made take on the MOBA and FPS genre, with a diverse and fun cast of characters to choose from and fairly elaborate maps, no two matches would ever feel the same.

Of course, it wasn’t perfect. Balancing issues, bugs, the toxic community, among other things, did make it feel like a chore to play sometimes. But it was still very much alright, more than enough to be well worth the price tag.

And the cinematics, the new map releases, the hero teasers, the events,… truly, with the way things were going, this supposed “TF2 killer” was rising its way up on the internet, every day selling more copies, getting more views on twitch and youtube, fan content on twitter, tumblr, facebook...

And then, things started to decline. Everything that made it great, was now becoming its hubris. Balancing patches upon balancing patches changed the meta in not very fun ways, some of the new heroes were either useless or busted, events started to get stale, and the releases of cinematics slowed down to a crawl.

The passion players had for the game gradually died down, and it didn’t help that many things that the devs promised never happened. And let’s not forget all the scandals inside Blizzard.

Finally, came Overwatch 2. And oh boy what a disappointment it was. The hero changes, smaller team size, battle pass, unlock system. There was no end to the absurdity of the situation. Have you ever seen players beg and plead for a lootbox system to be brought back? And worst of all, players like me, who paid more when they bought their copy of the game, didn’t even receive any form of bonus as compensation for the extra support way back then.

Overwatch 2 is not a spit on the face of Overwatch players, it’s an assault.

Also, it’s McCree. Not Cassidy.

Play Paladins instead. 
 
Don´t support devs that are capable of deleting the old game, which people had PAID for,...just to force them to play the „new“ free game.

I have had so many fun times playing this game, but I cant in good faith feel positively about it now because they removed the most fun part of the entire game (dps doom)

I don't have an issue with them monetizing the game more, it's needed in this day and age for the game to be stable and successful. But charging $20 for skins that you can only see 10% of when you play is definitely way harder to justify when compared to other third-person games where you can actually see the cool cosmetics you purchased.

The lack of the PvE they promised us is just really sad, and I feel for the devs who could not realize their vision of the actual substantial sequel they had planned for Overwatch 2. Fuck capitalism all my homies hate capitalism.

For real though, I miss dps doom so bad

[h1] TLDR: Pay 2 Win PVP nightmare. [/h1]

Got it late 2016/early 2017. In that time I'd gotten my border to 5 star gold (around 1701-1800 lvl). i've got over 1k hours in this game. Thats not a flex, but to emphasize that i'm not exactly new to this game. 

Unfortunately over time the game has suffered from a serious case of avarice. [b]You know a game has gotten bad when people want loot boxes to come back...[/b]

They keep finding new ways to empty your wallet. New ways to screw over its fanbase. And im not even going to go on about all the unethical BS that goes on behind the curtains at Blizz.

I made a new account not too long ago to see what playing the game was like for newbies. its hell. [b]its absolute hell 'earning' all those heroes. they WANT you to suffer, or GIVE THEM MONEY. [/b]

Its officially PAY-TO-WIN. This game is about strategy, which means countering your opponents heroes. which is basically impossible if you have a tiny little roster of heroes to pick from. And last i played as a new account, you could only earn the heroes by WINNING matches. not just playing them. no you gotta hope your 4 other teammates not only know what they are doing, but have all the heroes. On my main account, id get like, a 3-4 losing streak AT MOST(QP). on my
free account, i had a 32 loss streak. (you need 35 WINS to get each hero....separately...) I got as far as getting Echo and then i was done with that BS.

I can not, in good conscience, recommend this game. ESPECIALLY to anyone who has even a mild case of FOMO. 
(seriously, just go play exoprimal or something instead)

A sad shell of what the game hoped to be competitively, casually, and replayability wise. Changing the characters fundamental balancing every month or so around "high tier players", while abandoning all attempts to maintain a functional esports scene. They also love abandoning the replayability that genuinely interesting pve missions with character progression would have brought, totally ruining any chance for real story and character progession. But hey HERES A BATTLEPASS NOW! and those skins you use to be able to slowly earn your way towards over time by playing, oh right now you can pay 25$ and not earn them by playing, have fun!
Your better off going on PHub to watch Overwatch, at least they wont put a paywall behind new content that they promised for 6+ years.

I have roughly 200+ hours of experience playing the game through Battle.net. 

I first played Overwatch towards the end of its closed beta period and I fell in love almost immediately. The game used to have a certain magic to it that I can't really describe. The game was truly exciting.  But after a few years showing corporate greed, the prioritization of Overwatch League over the game itself and its player base, and the announcement of a sequel that no one asked for only to be released as a bastardized, half-baked mess of what we were promised, Overwatch has killed a lot of its good will for me and a lot of other people. I personally moved on to Apex which I've now sunk more hours into than this. The game is a shallow shell of what it once was and it's a crying shame. The game itself could always use more heroes, though. Heroes that would actually make it worth playing again.
I love this game, don't get me wrong, but it's been severely mistreated by Blizzard. Bring back the cancelled PVE content.

overwatch is a game?

Don't let the low hours here hold sway, I actually have about +800 hrs on Bnet. 
The original game had some good gameplay in terms of a hero shooter. Everything felt a bit smooth with that old Blizzard Refinement. But OW2 is a complete cash grab that killed any hope for making this game any better. If your new monetization strategy is WORSE than  lootboxes, you have done something wrong. Blizzard absolutely castrated the ONLY real reason we needed a Sequel to Overwatch: The PvE campaign/missions. Pre-launch we were promised a fleshed out story/campaign to satisfy those who really liked the lore and many characters in the game. Just please do not play this game to spend a single cent in the predatory shop. I paid the original $40(?) price tag and got my fill with friends, events, ranked, and lore.  But even with this version being Free, I feel cheated out of what could've been a potential competitor to other Hero Shooters.
